Interface RoutingAlgorithm

  • public interface RoutingAlgorithm
    The RoutingAlgorithm interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to provide the routing algorithm. The class that implements this algorithm must have a zero argument constructor.
    Since:
    JDK1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Packet generateRoutingPacket​(int iface)
      Generates a routing packet from the routing table.
      int getNextHop​(int destination)
      Given a destination address, returns the out going interface for that address, -1 is returned for a local address, -2 is an unknown address.
      void initalise()
      Initialise the routing algorthm.
      void processRoutingPacket​(Packet p, int iface)
      Given a routing packet from another router, process it (unless the interface is down) and update the routing table.
      void setAllowExpire​(boolean flag)
      Enables or disables routing table entry expiration.
      void setAllowPReverse​(boolean flag)
      Enables or disables split horizon with poison reverse.
      void setRouterObject​(Router obj)
      Passes the router object to the Routing algorithm, so that the algorithm can retreive values from the router.
      void setUpdateInterval​(int interval)
      Sets the routing update interval in time slots.
      void showRoutes()
      Prints the routing table to the screen.
      void tidyTable()
      A periodic task to refresh the routing-table entries on the basis of their expiration time, and on whether the corresponding interfaces are up/down.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextHop

        int getNextHop​(int destination)
        Given a destination address, returns the out going interface for that address, -1 is returned for a local address, -2 is an unknown address.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination address
        Returns:
        the local interface

      • setRouterObject

        void setRouterObject​(Router obj)
        Passes the router object to the Routing algorithm, so that the algorithm can retreive values from the router.
        Parameters:
        obj -

      • setUpdateInterval

        void setUpdateInterval​(int interval)
        Sets the routing update interval in time slots.
        Parameters:
        interval - the update interval

      • generateRoutingPacket

        Packet generateRoutingPacket​(int iface)
        Generates a routing packet from the routing table.
        Parameters:
        iface - interface id
        Returns:
        Packet

      • processRoutingPacket

        void processRoutingPacket​(Packet p,
                          int iface)
        Given a routing packet from another router, process it (unless the interface is down) and update the routing table.
        Parameters:
        p - the packet to process
        iface - the interface it came in on

      • tidyTable

        void tidyTable()
        A periodic task to refresh the routing-table entries on the basis of their expiration time, and on whether the corresponding interfaces are up/down. This method is called before processing any new packets each round.

      • initalise

        void initalise()
        Initialise the routing algorthm. This must be called once the setRouterObject has been called.

      • showRoutes

        void showRoutes()
        Prints the routing table to the screen. The format is : Router d i m d i m d i m

      • setAllowPReverse

        void setAllowPReverse​(boolean flag)
        Enables or disables split horizon with poison reverse.
        Parameters:
        flag - a boolean indicating whether split horizon with poison reverse is on or off.

      • setAllowExpire

        void setAllowExpire​(boolean flag)
        Enables or disables routing table entry expiration.
        Parameters:
        flag - a boolean indicating whether entry expiration is on or off.
